intro: Phyllanthus ceratostemon, commonly known as the horned spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia, including India, China, and Southeast Asia. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and distinctive yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in cymes. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and waste areas. The plant contains various bioactive compounds and has been used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
